raw.title: [BIP-533] Initiate Cooldown to Withdraw from BAL/AURA/ARB Pool on Arbitrum
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/741

## Overview 

Originally proposed and executed upon [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/rfc-allocate-balancers-3m-arb/4682), Balancer DAO had deposited 2M ARB along with BAL provide by the treasury, and AURA provided by Aura Finance.  There was a special contract made that these LP tokens are held in that requires a 60 day cooldown period before the funds can be withdrawn. The funds are held in [this contract](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x8d803f7f7e26e586ee90e5a872cf7830e21f7727#code)

This pool has since incurred a significant amount of IL, and I believe it to be prudent to withdraw from this pool in order to hold onto that ARB and use it at a later date.  There are discussions about leaving 25% in the pool to support bal/aura liquidity on arbitrum, but specifics will come at a later date so we can get the ball rolling to make sure we can withdraw as soon as possible.  

#### Specifications:

The DAO multisig `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0 ` will call startCooldown() on the contract at `0x8d803f7f7e26e586ee90e5a872cf7830e21f7727`.  Further actions will come at a later date in a separate proposal.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-516] Exit from D2D/BAL pool
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/699

## Intro

PrimeDAO, issuer of D2D tokens, has a long relationship with Balancer. Back in Nov’21, a [partnership was approved](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/draft-partnership-agreement-balancerdao-primedao/2363) by governance to seed liquidity in a [D2D/BAL](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x8f4205e1604133d1875a3e771ae7e4f2b086563900020000000000000000010e) pool. This pool has suffered severe losses and, as of today, Balancer is practically its sole LP, with ~$32k worth in its position. Currently, the pool sees little to no action and Prime DAO only has incentives to LM on [D2D/USDC (Ethereum)](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x27c9f71cc31464b906e0006d4fcbc8900f48f15f00020000000000000000010f) and [D2D/rETH (Arbitrum)](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x835772bab114563746da80806930a9e37aa853440002000000000000000004c0).

## Proposal

This proposal seeks to unstake and withdraw proportionally (50/50) from the position, keeping both the D2D and BAL tokens back in the Treasury.

It’s our expectation that BAL with grow in value somewhat still correlated to ETH, and D2D might not see the same upside, therefore taking even more IL in this position. This way, we can save whatever BAL we have left (~4k at the time of writing).

There’s not enough liquidity on-chain to sell D2D and we are not looking to kill our partnership, so other strategies for using the D2D may be presented to governance as appropriate.

Noting that these assets were not under Karpartkey's management.

## Specification

The DAO multisig on Ethereum 0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f interact with the D2D-BAL BPT token contract at `0x8f4205e1604133d1875a3E771AE7e4F2b0865639` and call `transfer` with arguments
`recipient` as the Maxis LM multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` and
`amount` as `136955000000000000000000` representing the LP tokens currently held by the DAO multi-sig
After the funds have been transfered to the Maxi LM multi-sig, it will execute a withdrawal and transfer of funds to the Balancer DAO multi-sig concluding the transaction.

Pool:  [D2D/BAL](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x8f4205e1604133d1875a3e771ae7e4f2b086563900020000000000000000010e)
BPT Token holdings reference: https://etherscan.io/token/0x8f4205e1604133d1875a3e771ae7e4f2b0865639?a=0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-453] Deposit 160k BAL into Aave v3
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
Payload With PR
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/550

### Summary & Motivation

Since inception Balancer has been closely partnered with Aave, be it through their safety module on v1, boosted pools for a period of time, and as a delegate and voter. Balancer DAO has a large sum of BAL tokens idle in the treasury, and one of the best possible ways to benefit ourselves and the greater ecosystem would to have BAL available to borrow on Aave. The treasury would earn returns on the deposit, and anyone interested in borrowing BAL would have access. 

At the time of writing 188.34k out of 350k total BAL is deposited in the Aave v3 [module](https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0xba100000625a3754423978a60c9317c58a424e3d&marketName=proto_mainnet_v3). I propose we deposit 160k, nearly the total remaining supply possible. As time goes on we can increase or decrease this strategy depending on market conditions. 

Specification:

The DAO Multisig on mainnet `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the BAL token address `0xba100000625a3754423978a60c9317c58a424e3D` by writing the `approve` function with spender(address) as Aave v3's proxy `0x87870Bca3F3fD6335C3F4ce8392D69350B4fA4E2` and amount as `160000000000000000000000`. 

Then the DAO Multisig will then interact with Aave's contract `0x87870Bca3F3fD6335C3F4ce8392D69350B4fA4E2` by writing the `supply` function with the following arguements: 
- asset: `0xba100000625a3754423978a60c9317c58a424e3D` 
- amount: `160000000000000000000000`
- onBehalfOf: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`
- referralCode: `0`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-464] Remove BAL from Deprecated Ribbon Vault
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-464] Remove BAL from Deprecated Ribbon Vault
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
Payload with PR:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/592

#### Summary:

[BIP-24](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-24-allocate-bal-to-a-ribbon-finance-vault/3209) and [BIP-227](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-227-upsize-bal-allocation-in-ribbon-finance-treasury-vault/4530) permitted the DAO to initially deposit BAL into a Ribbon Finance vault, and then upsize the position. Recently, Ribbon has since decided to deprecate this covered call strategy vault, and it no longer will be a place for the DAO to earn passive income. The proposal is meant to enable the DAO to claim back the deposited funds to hold in the treasury. 

#### Motivation:

As stated in the Summary, because this position will no longer be supported by Ribbon, the DAO should claim back these funds. Funds can be put to work elsewhere, but there is no sense in leaving them idle with nothing to be gained in the deprecated vault. 

#### Specification:

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Ribbon Vault at `0x2a6B048eB15C7d4ddCa27db4f9A454196898A0Fe` by writing `initiateWithdraw` passing numShares as `200000000000000000000000`. This will take until the expiration of the next Ribbon round to register, at which time the BAL will be released for direct claim. 

Upon release, the DAO Multisig will interact with the same Ribbon vault as noted above and write the `completeWithdraw`

The full payload cannot simulate due to the time dependence of the prior step. 
[initiateWithdraw](https://dashboard.tenderly.co/public/safe/safe-apps/simulator/78d6bcec-7e99-416d-9602-d97f691f4931) simulation
[Full transaction](https://dashboard.tenderly.co/public/safe/safe-apps/simulator/e56fec9a-382c-4fc6-be21-2679e0e562c7?trace=0.0.2.0.0.1.0.0.0) simulation with revert.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: This proposal seeks to execute the exit and withdraw from the BAL/AURA/ARB pool on Arbitrum, returning tokens to respective DAO multisigs. The timeline metrics show unanimous and stable early voting support for the 'Yes' option. Forum sentiment is neutral with supportive comments appreciating the clarity and readiness of the proposal. Similar past proposals aimed to generate treasury revenue and enable deployments, both passing with positive market responses, reinforcing this action as beneficial.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous timeline and voting support with stability and early participation.
Historical precedent of similar proposals passing with positive market and TVL impacts.
Neutral-to-positive forum sentiment appreciating the proposal's clarity and execution readiness.
Proposal execution aligns with prior cooldown withdrawal steps, completing a planned process.
key_arguments_against: Potential market price and TVL impact declines noted currently, though unrelated to vote outcome.
No explicit negative forum sentiment, but lack of strong positive sentiment suggests cautious optimism.

evidence.quote: Three forum comments with neutral sentiment, expressing gratitude and procedural notes on execution.
Lead ratio total 1.0 for 'Yes' choice, stability 1.0, early voting ratio 1.0, indicating strong early and sustained support.

evidence.reference: Historical similar proposals BIP-590 and BIP-589
evidence.quote: Similar proposals passed with 'Yes' votes and positive price and TVL impacts, supporting the change stance.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline metrics, forum sentiment, and historical lessons, independent of final tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline metrics indicate unanimous and stable support for 'Yes' throughout voting phases.
- Forum sentiment is neutral but positive in tone, with no opposition, indicating community alignment.
- Historical similar proposals successfully passed and resulted in beneficial treasury and deployment outcomes, supporting this proposal's approach.
- Despite current negative price and TVL impact noted, this is external to vote dynamics and should not deter the proposal, which completes a planned withdrawal process.
- The recommendation mirrors forum opinion and voting momentum, supporting a positive change stance.
